description.value: Create a referral for a patient and send it for triage at the selected service.

documentation.value: The NHS Number of the patient who the referral being created is for. Format: ^[0-9]{10}$
Required if and only if the logged in user has a role of Referring Clinician Admin. Format: ^[0-9]{12}$

An indication of whether the referral is to be marked as 'Sensitive'. If True, then users with non-clinical roles (e.g. Referring Admins and Service Provider Admin) will not be able to view the referral details.
When sending for triage, the shortlist must contain exactly one service, and this must support the ‘triage request flow’.

An explanation of the reason why the user decided to shortlist an 'unaccredited' service, thus overriding the referrer rights rules that had been set for that service. Required if and only if the shortlist contains one or more 'unaccredited' services.

This parameter triggers a reminder letter to the patient to prompt them to book an appointment if they haven’t done so after x days. When sending for triage, the only acceptable value is 0, which means no follow up letter will be sent, as the patient does not need to book an appointment.
When sending for triage, a referral letter is always required; therefore the only acceptable value is NEED_TO_ADD_LATER.
The referral request that will be created.
